intro: Rindera tetraspis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rindera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and prolonged flowering period. It is relatively easy to cultivate in warm climates with well-drained soil.
